trans-unit.source: Provisioning the GIT repos - (VSC task)
trans-unit.target: Provisioning the GIT repos - (VSC task)

trans-unit.source: After all the following steps are completed, Open Publishing will automatically build and publish the updated content from a monitored docset to MSDN, TechNet, or VS.com web sites.
trans-unit.target: After all the following steps are completed, Open Publishing will automatically build and publish the updated content from a monitored docset to MSDN, TechNet, or VS.com web sites.

trans-unit.source: You should have got from the partner the information listed in the <linkText>repo creation page</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: You should have got from the partner the information listed in the <linkText>repo creation page</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: You can get a sample of the files to be added to the repo from this site.
trans-unit.target: You can get a sample of the files to be added to the repo from this site.

trans-unit.source: 1. Making the repo an Open Publishing repo
trans-unit.target: 1. Making the repo an Open Publishing repo

trans-unit.source: 1.1. Adding the Publishing Service Configuration File: .openpublishing.publish.config.json
trans-unit.target: 1.1. Adding the Publishing Service Configuration File: .openpublishing.publish.config.json

trans-unit.source: This file needs to be under the repository.
trans-unit.target: This file needs to be under the repository.

trans-unit.source: This file tells Open Publishing how to build and publish the content found in the GIT repo.
trans-unit.target: This file tells Open Publishing how to build and publish the content found in the GIT repo.

trans-unit.source: build_entry_point: Indicate how to run the build.
trans-unit.target: build_entry_point: Indicate how to run the build.

trans-unit.source: User can either use the build tool OP provides or use their own tools to build the content.
trans-unit.target: User can either use the build tool OP provides or use their own tools to build the content.

trans-unit.source: docsets_to_publish: A collection of docsets that need to be published.
trans-unit.target: docsets_to_publish: A collection of docsets that need to be published.

trans-unit.source: docset_name - Provide the name of the docset.
trans-unit.target: docset_name - Provide the name of the docset.

trans-unit.source: This docset need to provisioned on portal at first, otherwise the content under the docset won't be published.
trans-unit.target: This docset need to provisioned on portal at first, otherwise the content under the docset won't be published.

trans-unit.source: For different docsets the names should be different.
trans-unit.target: For different docsets the names should be different.

trans-unit.source: For docsets that just different in locale or version, the name should be same.
trans-unit.target: For docsets that just different in locale or version, the name should be same.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the fallback logic won't work.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the fallback logic won't work.

trans-unit.source: "build_output_subfolder" - The relative output sub folder of build tool.
trans-unit.target: "build_output_subfolder" - The relative output sub folder of build tool.

trans-unit.source: Content that has been built will be put there.
trans-unit.target: Content that has been built will be put there.

trans-unit.source: Only content under that folder will be published.
trans-unit.target: Only content under that folder will be published.

trans-unit.source: So this value depends on the build tools.
trans-unit.target: So this value depends on the build tools.

trans-unit.source: version - Version of current content.
trans-unit.target: version - Version of current content.

trans-unit.source: Start from 0.
trans-unit.target: Start from 0.

trans-unit.source: locale - Just leave it as 'en-us' as localized repos are created/configured using the .localization-config file.
trans-unit.target: locale - Just leave it as 'en-us' as localized repos are created/configured using the .localization-config file.

trans-unit.source: open_to_public_contributors
trans-unit.target: open_to_public_contributors

trans-unit.source: Set to true if you want your customers to contribute to the content.
trans-unit.target: Set to true if you want your customers to contribute to the content.

trans-unit.source: Set to false if you do not want your customers to contribute to the content.
trans-unit.target: Set to false if you do not want your customers to contribute to the content.

trans-unit.source: notification_subscribers - Provide the email array of some ones who want to receive the notification.
trans-unit.target: notification_subscribers - Provide the email array of some ones who want to receive the notification.

trans-unit.source: branches_to_filter - Provide the branch array which will won't be monitored by OP build and publish.
trans-unit.target: branches_to_filter - Provide the branch array which will won't be monitored by OP build and publish.

trans-unit.source: 1.2. Provisioning on the portal
trans-unit.target: 1.2. Provisioning on the portal

trans-unit.source: Once you have the publish configuration file under the repository and make sure you also have the live branch contains that configuration file, go to <linkText>portal</linkText><title></title> to have the repo monitored.
trans-unit.target: Once you have the publish configuration file under the repository and make sure you also have the live branch contains that configuration file, go to <linkText>portal</linkText><title></title> to have the repo monitored.

trans-unit.source: Open Publishing portal will only parse the configuration file under live branch when doing provision.
trans-unit.target: Open Publishing portal will only parse the configuration file under live branch when doing provision.

trans-unit.source: "Base Path": It can be configured via the portal.
trans-unit.target: "Base Path": It can be configured via the portal.

trans-unit.source: This field would be the common base path for all the topics in this docset, and is eventually part of the rendering URL.
trans-unit.target: This field would be the common base path for all the topics in this docset, and is eventually part of the rendering URL.

trans-unit.source: 2. Adding the Build Tools Configuration
trans-unit.target: 2. Adding the Build Tools Configuration

trans-unit.source: The Open Publishing service provides the entry point for how to build the content.
trans-unit.target: The Open Publishing service provides the entry point for how to build the content.

trans-unit.source: Users can either use their own build tools or use the build tool provided by Open Publishing service.
trans-unit.target: Users can either use their own build tools or use the build tool provided by Open Publishing service.

trans-unit.source: Open Publishing currently has two build tools.
trans-unit.target: Open Publishing currently has two build tools.

trans-unit.source: The first build tool only has a simple function to build Markdown content.
trans-unit.target: The first build tool only has a simple function to build Markdown content.

trans-unit.source: The is a powerful build tool called DocasCode (link will follow).
trans-unit.target: The is a powerful build tool called DocasCode (link will follow).

trans-unit.source: In addition to Markdown it can build documentation from specific language source code.
trans-unit.target: In addition to Markdown it can build documentation from specific language source code.

trans-unit.source: 2.1 Assign the build tools provided by Open Publishing
trans-unit.target: 2.1 Assign the build tools provided by Open Publishing

trans-unit.source: 2.1.1 Simple Build Tool for Markdown
trans-unit.target: 2.1.1 Simple Build Tool for Markdown

trans-unit.source: Two files need to be added under the repository folder Tools/Nuget.
trans-unit.target: Two files need to be added under the repository folder Tools/Nuget.

trans-unit.source: They are <linkText>Nuget.Config</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>nuget.exe</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: They are <linkText>Nuget.Config</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>nuget.exe</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Some global build configuration files need to be added at the root of the repository.
trans-unit.target: Some global build configuration files need to be added at the root of the repository.

trans-unit.source: .openpublishing.build.config.json: Tells build tool how many docsets to build.
trans-unit.target: .openpublishing.build.config.json: Tells build tool how many docsets to build.

trans-unit.source: Two corresponding docset configuration file should be also added to each docset:
trans-unit.target: Two corresponding docset configuration file should be also added to each docset:

trans-unit.source: .openpublish.build.docset.json
trans-unit.target: .openpublish.build.docset.json

trans-unit.source: toc_file: Points to the location of the curerent docset file, in general, "TOC.md".
trans-unit.target: toc_file: Points to the location of the curerent docset file, in general, "TOC.md".

trans-unit.source: exclude_path_patterns - specify file extensions of files you would like the build to ignore.
trans-unit.target: exclude_path_patterns - specify file extensions of files you would like the build to ignore.

trans-unit.source: Example: [ "*.vsdx" ]
trans-unit.target: Example: [ "*.vsdx" ]

trans-unit.source: common_metadata - Metadata supported so far:
trans-unit.target: common_metadata - Metadata supported so far:

trans-unit.source: "ROBOTS": "NOINDEX, NOFOLLOW"
trans-unit.target: "ROBOTS": "NOINDEX, NOFOLLOW"

trans-unit.source: *make sure to add Robots = Index and Follow to get the content indexed *
trans-unit.target: *make sure to add Robots = Index and Follow to get the content indexed *

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TOC.md</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TOC.md</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: .openpublishing.build.mdproj: The build target of msbuild.
trans-unit.target: .openpublishing.build.mdproj: The build target of msbuild.

trans-unit.source: User can also inject custom steps using msbuild language or just copy it from this repo to use that.
trans-unit.target: User can also inject custom steps using msbuild language or just copy it from this repo to use that.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>packages.config</linkText><title></title>: Indicates the version of build tool.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>packages.config</linkText><title></title>: Indicates the version of build tool.

trans-unit.source: Tool with different versions will have different capabilities.
trans-unit.target: Tool with different versions will have different capabilities.

trans-unit.source: By default, the latest version will always be used.
trans-unit.target: By default, the latest version will always be used.

trans-unit.source: However, if you user like to use a previous version (they might not need all the functionality that is available and might make your build slower), then they can specify the version here.
trans-unit.target: However, if you user like to use a previous version (they might not need all the functionality that is available and might make your build slower), then they can specify the version here.

trans-unit.source: The engineering team will maintain a list of all the packages available and main features for each.
trans-unit.target: The engineering team will maintain a list of all the packages available and main features for each.

trans-unit.source: 2.1.2 DocasCode
trans-unit.target: 2.1.2 DocasCode

trans-unit.source: - Coming Soon~
trans-unit.target: - Coming Soon~

trans-unit.source: 2.2. How to use the external tool to build the markdown content
trans-unit.target: 2.2. How to use the external tool to build the markdown content
